definition: ordinary/commonplace/mundane/temporal/of the material world (as opposed to supernatural or immortal levels)/every/all/whatever/altogether/gist/outline/note of Chinese musical scale
(classical) this, that/he, she, they/(exclamatory final particle)/(initial particle, introduces an opinion)

sentences.english: The law of cause and effect is such a subtle thing that no ordinary person can fully explain it.
sentences.chinese: 因果定律深妙難思，凡夫是不可能說得清的。

sentences.english: The supernal ideology will not coexistence with the everyman.
sentences.chinese: 超凡的思想是不會與凡夫俗子共存的。

sentences.english: This is also held to be true with the common people.
Everyman, there are who can get rid of "gains and losses, " the word it?
sentences.chinese: 凡夫俗子中，有誰能擺脫“得失”二字呢？

sentences.english: Nevertheless, Chinsim of common people was covered with improper thought and could not be emerged.
sentences.chinese: 但凡夫的真心被妄念所覆，不得顯現。

sentences.english: A month ago, he was a man of men .
sentences.chinese: 一個月前，他是一個凡夫俗子。

sentences.english: The sentence was really true, "Everyone else is Buddha while only I am no more than a human. ""
sentences.chinese: 真是看一切人都是菩薩，唯我一人實是凡夫。

sentences.english: And deep down in his heart, there is not a single day when he can be completely satisfied with them.
sentences.chinese: 一切凡夫常被五欲所苦惱，內心永久沒有滿足的一天。

sentences.english: See all the people are Buddha, the only one I really unholy.
sentences.chinese: 看一切人都是菩薩，唯我一人實是凡夫。

sentences.english: So are the vulgar people in the world.
No matter the common people or repelled ones who all can follow Jesus.
sentences.chinese: 不論凡夫俗子或被唾棄者，都能跟從耶穌。

definition: arhat (Sanskrit)/a holy man who has left behind all earthly desires and concerns and attained nirvana (Buddhism)
Hinayana, the Lesser Vehicle/Buddhism in India before the Mayahana sutras/also pr. [Xiao3 cheng2]
Dharma (the teachings of the Buddha)/Buddhist doctrine
actual situation/the ultimate essence of things (Buddhism)

the Four Noble Truths (Budd.), namely: all life is suffering 苦, the cause of suffering is desire 集, emancipation comes only by eliminating passions 滅|灭, the way 道 to emancipation is the Eight-fold Noble Way 八正道/also called 四諦|四谛
(of a deity) to take a material shape/to appear
to become a Buddha/to attain enlightenment
